text: Transcription factor requirements for U2 snRNA-encoding gene activation in B lymphoid cells .

Transcription of a human U2 small nuclear RNA ( snRNA ) - encoding gene in HeLa cells requires a distal enhancer element , which is composed of one octamer motif ( Oct ) and three <extra_id_0> Sp 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding sites .
To study the transcription factor requirement in B-cells , different U2 enhancer constructions were transfected into the lymphoid cell line , BJA-B .
The results showed that the activation of U2 snRNA transcription in B-cells also requires an enhancer comprising both the Oct and at least one Sp 1 - binding site .

Deletion of all the <extra_id_0> Sp 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding sites from the enhancer reduces transcription by 80-90 % in HeLa , as well as in BJA-B cells , whereas the removal of the octamer - binding site reduces transcription to levels below detection in both cell types .

Enhancers containing a single Oct have , nevertheless , the capacity to partially activate U2 snRNA transcription in both HeLa cells , in which only <extra_id_0> OTF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is expressed , and in BJA-B cells in which <extra_id_0> OTF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is the predominantly expressed octamer - binding factor .

text: The most likely interpretation of our results is that both the ubiquitous transcription factor , <extra_id_0> OTF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and the B-cell - specific transcription factor , <extra_id_0> OTF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , can activate U2 snRNA transcription .

The results also revealed a similar functional cooperation between the transcription factors which bind to the Oct and the adjacent <extra_id_0> Sp 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding site in BJA-B cells , as has been observed in HeLa cells , since a template which contains a weak binding site for OTFs expresses wild-type levels of U2 snRNA in both cell types when the weak octamer - binding site is combined with a <extra_id_0> Sp 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding site .
